title: Isaiah Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Isaiah with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 66 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the author of the vision recorded in Isaiah chapter 1?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 1:1 clearly states that the vision was of Isaiah the son of Amoz.

questions.question: What does the ox know according to Isaiah 1:3?
questions.explanation: The verse says the ox knoweth his owner, and the ass his master's crib.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 1:17, what should we learn to do?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 1:17 exhorts to learn to do well, seek judgment, relieve the oppressed.

questions.question: What will happen to the city of Jerusalem according to Isaiah 1:26?
options: It will be called The city of righteousness
It will be made a wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: It will be called The city of righteousness
questions.explanation: Isaiah 1:26 promises restoration and that Jerusalem will be called The city of righteousness.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Except the LORD of hosts had left unto us a very small _____, we should have been as Sodom...'
questions.explanation: Isaiah 1:9 speaks of a very small remnant left by the LORD of hosts.

questions.question: What is the burden of Damascus according to Isaiah 17:1?
options: Damascus will become a ruinous heap
Damascus will be destroyed by fire
questions.correctAnswer: Damascus will become a ruinous heap
questions.explanation: Isaiah 17:1 states that Damascus is taken away and shall be a ruinous heap.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 17:7, what will a man look to in that day?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 17:7 says at that day a man shall look to his Maker.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 17:8 says people shall look to the altars and images for help in the day of trouble.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 17:8 says people shall not look to altars or images, the work of their hands.

questions.question: What will happen to the nations that rush like many waters according to Isaiah 17:13?
options: They shall be rebuked by God and flee far off
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be rebuked by God and flee far off
questions.explanation: Isaiah 17:13 says God will rebuke the nations and they shall flee as chaff.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 33:2, what did the people do at the noise of the tumult?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 33:3 states at the noise of the tumult the people fled.

questions.question: Who is exalted and dwells on high according to Isaiah 33:5?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 33:5 says the LORD is exalted for He dwelleth on high.

questions.question: What treasure is mentioned in Isaiah 33:6 as the stability of times?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 33:6 mentions fear of the LORD as his treasure and the stability of times.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of _____...'
questions.explanation: Isaiah 33:15 describes the righteous as one who despiseth the gain of oppressions.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 33:16, where shall the righteous dwell?
options: On high, with munitions of rocks
questions.correctAnswer: On high, with munitions of rocks
questions.explanation: Isaiah 33:16 says the righteous shall dwell on high; his place of defence shall be the munitions of rocks.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 33:20 states that Jerusalem will be a tabernacle that can be taken down.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 33:20 describes Jerusalem as a tabernacle that shall not be taken down.

questions.question: Who is referred to as the servant in Isaiah 49:3?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 49:3 says, 'Thou art my servant, O Israel'.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 49:4 expresses that the servant’s work was in vain and without hope.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 49:4 shows the servant felt his labour was in vain but declares his judgment is with the LORD.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 49:6, for whom is the servant made a light?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 49:6 says the servant will be a light to the Gentiles.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'They shall not hunger nor thirst; neither shall the heat nor sun smite them: for he that hath _____ on them shall lead them...'
questions.explanation: Isaiah 49:10 states that he that hath mercy on them shall lead them.

questions.question: Which kings will see and worship the servant according to Isaiah 49:7?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 49:7 says kings shall see and arise; princes shall worship the servant.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 1:15 says that when people make many prayers, the LORD will hear them.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 1:15 says when they make many prayers, the LORD will not hear because their hands are full of blood.

questions.question: What are the new moons and sabbaths described as in Isaiah 1:13?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 1:13 says incense, new moons, and sabbaths are an abomination to the LORD.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Your country is desolate, your cities are burned with _____...'
questions.explanation: Isaiah 1:7 states the cities are burned with fire.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 3:16, what is the behavior of the daughters of Zion?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 3:16 describes the daughters of Zion as proud and haughty.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 10:1 warns against making unjust laws and oppressive decrees.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 10:1 condemns those who make unjust laws to oppress the poor and needy.

questions.question: What will the Lord do to Assyria according to Isaiah 10:12?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 10:12 says the LORD will punish Assyria for their arrogance.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 11:6, which animals will live together peacefully?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 11:6 describes the wolf dwelling with the lamb in peace.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 12:2 calls the LORD our strength and salvation.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 12:2 declares the LORD as strength and salvation.

questions.question: What is the 'branch' referred to in Isaiah 11:1?
options: A shoot from the stump of Jesse
questions.correctAnswer: A shoot from the stump of Jesse
questions.explanation: Isaiah 11:1 speaks of a branch growing from the roots of Jesse, symbolizing the Messiah.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 24:23, what will be revealed when the LORD reigns in Mount Zion?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 24:23 says the moon and sun will be ashamed, but the LORD will reign in Mount Zion.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 40:31 says those who wait on the LORD shall renew their strength.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 40:31 promises renewed strength for those who trust the LORD.

questions.question: What does Isaiah 42:1 call the servant of the LORD?
options: My chosen, in whom my soul delighteth
questions.correctAnswer: My chosen, in whom my soul delighteth
questions.explanation: Isaiah 42:1 refers to the servant as chosen and beloved of God.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'Comfort ye, comfort ye my people, saith your God. Speak ye comfortably to Jerusalem...' (Isaiah 40:1)
questions.explanation: Isaiah 40:1 calls to comfort God’s people and cry unto Jerusalem.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 53:5, by whose stripes are we healed?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 53:5 refers to healing by the stripes of the suffering servant.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 55:8 says God's thoughts are higher than our thoughts.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 55:8 states God's ways and thoughts are higher than ours.

questions.question: What will the new heavens and new earth be called in Isaiah 65:17?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 65:17 speaks of new heavens and a new earth.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'For, behold, I create _____, not a noise; and he that createth it maketh peace...' (Isaiah 65:25)
questions.explanation: Isaiah 65:25 speaks of the wolf and the lamb feeding together in peace.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 66:1 says heaven is God's throne and the earth is his footstool.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 66:1 declares heaven as God's throne and earth as his footstool.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 66:2, who does God look upon with favor?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 66:2 says God looks favorably on the humble and contrite in spirit.

questions.question: What will the LORD do to those who oppose Him according to Isaiah 66:5?
options: He will make peace with them
questions.explanation: Isaiah 66:5 warns that those who oppose the LORD will face His judgment.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 66:24 says the dead bodies of those who have transgressed shall not be consumed or have rest.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 66:24 describes the fate of those who rebelled against the LORD.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 55:1, what is offered without money and without price?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 55:1 invites all to come and buy water without money.

questions.question: What does Isaiah 6:8 record the prophet saying when the LORD called, 'Whom shall I send?'
questions.explanation: Isaiah 6:8 has the prophet volunteering to be sent by God.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 7:14 prophesies the birth of a child called Immanuel.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 7:14 prophesies a virgin shall bear a son called Immanuel.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 9:6, what titles are given to the child to be born?
options: Wonderful Counselor, The mighty God, The everlasting Father, The Prince of Peace
King of kings, Lord of lords, Almighty God, Savior
questions.correctAnswer: Wonderful Counselor, The mighty God, The everlasting Father, The Prince of Peace
questions.explanation: Isaiah 9:6 gives these four titles to the child to be born.
